All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
addAppointmentController
addAppointmentController Creates a new Appointment from a new view that will be displayed in the previous Appointment View.
addCustomerController
addCustomerControll This class allows the user to add a customer in the customer View.
Alerts
 
Appointment
This class is the model for the Appointment view carrying all the elements that will be manipulated by the user.
appointmentController
This class populates the view with all of the appointments on the schedule with buttons to edit, delete, and appointments.
AppointmentDB
This class gathers all the appointment from the Appointments table within the Database.
ContactDB
This class gathers all the contacts from the Contacts table within the Database.
Customer
This class is the model for the Customer object
customerController
This class shows all of the customers in the view.
CustomerDB
This class gathers all the customers from the Customers table within the Database.
DBConnection
 
editAppointmentController
This class allows the user to edit an Appointment in the Appointment list.
editCustomerController
This class allows the user to edit a Customer's information in a different view, reflected on the Customer view.
Logger
Logger class for appending strings of successful or failed login attempts accompanied by a timestamp
loginController
This class shows the login screen where the user can login, clear, or quit the app.
LogonSession
This class presents the logon screen for the user to enter their username and password
Main
This class creates a Scheduling app that connects to a DB opening a connect to manupulate the scheduling data from the database.
reportsController
This class creates three ways to create a report reflecting the information from the Appointment view and/or the Customer view.
User
This class gathers the username and password from login.
UserDB
This class gets all the users from the DB
